p: Wild larvae of An. gambiae ( s.l.) were collected from Magu district in Mwanza Region, North-Western Tanzania. Larvae were sampled from irrigated rice fields using a standard dipper (350 ml) [ 23] and transported to the insectary. Larvae were reared on yeast powder as a food source in the mosquito insectary unit at the Mwanza Research Centre, National Institute for Medical Research (NIMR), Tanzania. Colonies were maintained at 27 ± 2 °C, with a 12 h light: 12-h dark cycle.
